name: Bot de support multi-département avec commandes slash, Pinecone et Telegram
description:
## Mon bot Telegram fournit un support spécialisé grâce à des commandes slash dédiées pour différents départements. Les utilisateurs peuvent accéder directement à la bonne équipe de support en utilisant :

- /billing - Pour les questions de paiement et de facturation
- /tech-support - Pour une assistance technique
- /return-policy - Pour les retours et les remboursements

## **Fonctionnalités clés :**

- Routage basé sur des commandes 
- Accès direct au département via des commandes slash
## Gestion d'état 
- Suit les conversations actives dans PostgreSQL
## Intégration de la base de connaissances 
- Magasins de vecteurs Pinecone pour chaque département
## Mise à jour automatique 
- Les nouveaux documents Google Drive peuplent automatiquement la base de connaissances 
- Contexte conscient 
- Maintient le choix du département

parameters.text:
to connect to specific reply with their key:
for Billing: /billing
for Return Policy: /ReturnPolicy
for Tech Support: /TechSupport

reply with /start to get options. 
To end chat reply with /end

options.systemMessage:
=You are a helpful assistant

## job
-your  job  is guide user on respective department
- department: {{ $json.department }}

## source
- you can access data from respective vector store connected as tool
## note
- if user is on a department let say billing and asks questions for tech support respectully decline and ask user to end conversation with current department usind /end commant and start again
- be precise in answers

## signoff as john wick

parameters.query:
UPDATE tg_user_sessions
SET active = FALSE,
    department = NULL
WHERE user_id = {{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.from.id }};

parameters.content:
## working

- listens for messages
- /start or /end for conversations
- uses PostgreSQL for user choice of department
- data stored in pinecone vector store of respective departments
- pdf files in googledrive (pinecone will be updated when new pdf is added )

parameters.query:
UPDATE tg_user_sessions
SET active = TRUE,
    department = 'Return Policy'
WHERE user_id ={{ $json.result.chat.id }};

UPDATE tg_user_sessions
SET active = TRUE,
    department = 'Tech Support'
WHERE user_id ={{ $json.result.chat.id }};

UPDATE tg_user_sessions
SET active = TRUE,
    department = 'Billing'
WHERE user_id ={{ $json.result.chat.id }};

UPDATE tg_user_sessions
SET active = TRUE,
    department = NULL
WHERE user_id = {{ $('Telegram Trigger').item.json.message.from.id }};

parameters.text: provide correct dpt|for Billing: /billing for Return Policy: /ReturnPolicy for Tech Support: /TechSupport
